intro: Dodecasperma, commonly known as the "twelve-seed grass," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces a distinctive number of seeds, typically twelve, which is reflected in its scientific name. Dodecasperma species are native to various regions in Africa and are often found in arid or semi-arid environments. These plants are adapted to withstand drought conditions and play a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
